channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large van blocking footpath and taking up 2 parking spaces, 23rd October
item.description:
There has been a increasing number of van being left over night and as your can see it is blocking the footpath. They are also parking in a very unreasonable manner taking multiple parking bays limiting residents

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Amhurst Park, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rat infestation, 22nd October
item.description:
There is a growing rat infestaion in Fellows Court by cremer street. This is an increasing occurence where the pests are sighted repeatdely all day long. They are rapidly approaching drains,pipes and gardens which is affecting our homes.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Weymouth Terrace, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned trailer and washing machine, 22nd October
item.description:
This is getting a bit ridiculous, this trailer has been completely abandoned on a single yellow line outside 69 Swallowfield for over 2 months. I can clearly see it has been reported 5 times - why has it not been removed?? Itâ€™s got to the point where people think itâ€™s acceptable to leave their own junk next to it - see photo of a dumped washing machine. This is not related to the building works, itâ€™s a dumped vehicle with a flat tyre, thereâ€™s clearly no intention of someone picking this up can you please remove it?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swallowfield Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urgent rat infestation action required!!!!!!!, 22nd October
item.description:
URGENT rat infestation at Fellows Court, E2, near the entrance and bin area. Rats are seen daily running between the bushes and entrance. The red dot in the picture marks their nest, posing a serious health risk + requiring urgent council action!!!!!!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cremer Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All lamps out, 22nd October
item.description:
Every lamp post along the pavement is out and has been for weeks. I have previously reported on this and nothing has been done. Although on a busy road, this path is isolated and dangerous without proper lighting
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Way, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: All out - three or more street lights in a row

item.title: Phalic symbol painted on the pavement by paint left by constant flytippers, 22nd October
item.description:
There is someone who daily flytips by the pavement bin, yesterday they left a tin of paint and some wooden drawers, in the night a group of people took the paint and made a massive painting of a penis on the pavement that is extremely offensive and also a few doors away from a nursery school. Please could it be cleaned off the pavement ?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 89, Charlton Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor road surface near bus stop F Heath Road (On A207 Crayford Road), 22nd October
item.description:
Poor road surface - near bus stop F Heath Road (On A207 Crayford Road). Looks like areas where utilities have been repaired and the road surface relayed have failed. When riding a bicycle, these must be swerved round leading the bike into traffic. Problems are not solely at the bus stop, they are before (towards railway overbridge) and afterwards (until roundabout with Princes Road). This was reported under 8314678 but perhaps the term "miltiple potholes" was not correct.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crayford Road, Barnes Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
